block.p: Ashley Hill Snowdon, a daughter of Susie Snowdon of McLean, Va., and Richard W. Snowdon III of Washington, was married yesterday afternoon to Alan Elliott Blanchard, a son of Ann E. Blanchard and Alan F. Blanchard of New York. The Rev. Douglass T. Lind, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church of Stonington, Conn.

Mrs. Blanchard, 30, is a consultant in New York with TCC Group, which provides management assistance to nonprofit organizations and foundations. She graduated from Stanford and has a master's in public policy from the University of California, Berkeley.

Ashley Hill Snowdon, a daughter of Susie Snowdon of McLean, Va., and Richard W. Snowdon III of Washington, was married yesterday afternoon to Alan Elliott Blanchard, a son of Ann E. Blanchard and Alan F. Blanchard of New York. The Rev. Douglass T. Lind, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church of Stonington, Conn.

Ashley Hill Snowdon, a daughter of Susie Snowdon of McLean, Va., and Richard W. Snowdon III of Washington, was married yesterday afternoon to Alan Elliott Blanchard, a son of Ann E. Blanchard and Alan F. Blanchard of New York. The Rev. Douglass T. Lind, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church of Stonington, Conn.

Mrs. Blanchard, 30, is a consultant in New York with TCC Group, which provides management assistance to nonprofit organizations and foundations. She graduated from Stanford and has a master's in public policy from the University of California, Berkeley.

Her father is the managing partner of Trainum, Snowdon & Deane, a Washington law firm, and is the board chairman of Children's National Medical Center in Washington and a member of the Cathedral Chapter, the governing board of the Washington National Cathedral. He is also a board member of Arena Stage in Washington. The bride's mother is retired from the Dive Shop in Vienna, Va., where she organized and led scuba diving trips. The bride is the stepdaughter of Catherine E. Snowdon and of George S. Kush of McLean, Va.
Mr. Blanchard, 31, is a corporate associate with Debevoise & Plimpton in New York. He graduated cum laude from Yale and has a law degree cum laude from New York University.

His father is president emeritus of the Church Pension Group, which manages pensions, benefits and assets for the Episcopal Church, and is the vice chairman of the board of the Friends of Canterbury Cathedral, a fund-raising organization that also helps raise awareness of the church's international activities. He serves on the board of the Berkeley Divinity School at Yale.
